page.title: 16Traffic & Youth:Chinnor etc
page.content: Chinnor is only three miles from an M40 interchange and traffic from and to the Motorway is increasing . Heavy lorries pose particular problems-not just those to and from the Chinnor Cement Works. Small road junctions now take traffic for which they were never designed. One junction in particular has been the scene of many accidents in recent years. Demands have been voiced for a Chinnor By-pass; even a proposal that the Lewknor interchange be sealed off. The influx of newcomers to Chinnor has meant an expanding teenage population with a consequent need for suitable facilities. Unfortunately, public transport to local towns is limited and 'hitching lifts' is now common amongst these young people. Parents are concerned at the dangers inherent in this practice. (cont)
